quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Water and Planet
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, places, electricity. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This intricate name, given to water, is a common hoax to misleadingly present water as a dangerous and harmful compound.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dihydrogen monoxide (DHMO)

questions.question: Water is a powerful conductor of electricity.
Because of its unique properties in interacting with other substances, water is often referred to as the universal what?
The temperature of large bodies of water tends to vary much less, compared to that of land masses, why?

options.text: Water can absorb a tremendous amount of heat
Water responds more quickly to temperature changes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Water can absorb a tremendous amount of heat

questions.question: Water is divided into soft and hard, depending on its chemical composition. Hard water washes soap from your hands faster, because of its high contents of what?
As you calculate more and more decimal places for the mathematical constant pi, you will eventually reach Feynmans Point.  Which one of these most accurately defines Feynmans Point?

options.text: The place where the decimal value of pi shows three 9s in a row
The decimal place where we have five nines in a row
The decimal place where we have six zeros in a row
The last decimal place we know

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The place where the decimal value of pi shows three 9s in a row

questions.question: Waters extraordinary physical properties are a result of its chemical structure - it consists of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom bonded in what type of molecule?
Which of these statements regarding the mathematical constant, pi, is incorrect?

options.text: In September of 2002, Dr. Yasumasa Kanada at Tokyo University calculated pi to 1.2411trillion decimal places
There is no zero in the decimal expansion of pi
22/7 is a good approximation for the value of pi
The first written reference to the ratio of a circles circumference to its diameter was written about 1650 b.c.e

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: There is no zero in the decimal expansion of pi

questions.question: High surface tension, one of waters properties, is crucial for the survival of life on the planet, because it enables what vital process?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Transport of nutrients

questions.question: Extract from the Periwinkle plant is one of the worlds most powerful drugs, used to fight this disease.
A unique property of water is that its solid form, ice, does not sink as may be expected, but floats. What is the reason for this phenomenon?

options.text: The specific resistance of water to solids
Temperature differences between the solid and liquid forms
Lower volume of ice compared to liquid water
Lower density of ice compared to liquid water

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lower density of ice compared to liquid water

questions.question: Rain forests are home to approximately what percentage of all the living animal and plant species on the planet?
Which of the following is typical for the Rainforest trees and cannot be seen in trees at higher latitudes?
In meteorology, virga, a weather phenomenon typical for desert regions, is what form of precipitation?

options.text: Precipitation that evaporates before reaching the ground
Precipitation that freezes before reaching the ground
Precipitation that has not undergone condensation

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Precipitation that evaporates before reaching the ground

questions.question: Although it is generally described as a transparent liquid, in seas, lakes and other large water bodies, water appears blue.  What property of water is this attributed to?

options.text: Water reflects light in the red range
Water absorbs light in the red range
Water radiates in the blue range

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Water absorbs light in the red range

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Domain and Following
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, amazon, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which domain is used by European Union institutions?
The Toco Toucans strange appearance is due this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its bill

questions.question: The .aq domain name is reserved to which of the following?

options.text: Organizations that work in or promote Antarctica
Countries that have Arctic Ocean shore (Canada, Greenland, Norway, Russia and USA)
Anyone who pays to the appropriate authority of Argentina

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Organizations that work in or promote Antarctica

questions.question: Which of the following owns the .fm domain name that is popular among radio stations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Federated States of Micronesia

questions.question: What is the most likely suffix of a web page established by a Scottish company or individual?
Which domain name is owned by Spain?

options.text: Spain is the only country without a national domain

questions.question: 123facts.com is a great site, isnt it? But do you know what the .com part stands for?
I am from a country in Central Europe. Which domain name do I most likely type to access pages in my native language?
If you established Trivia TV and wanted a web site in the .tv domain, which of the following would earn some money?
The source of the Amazon, the widest river in the world, is located in this area of Peru.
Which country owns the .ie domain name?
What does the scientific name of the King cobra, Ophiophagus, mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snake eater

questions.question: If 123facts.de existed, in which language would the quizzes most likely be written?
Who may use the .gov domain?

options.text: Governments of any country (payment goes to UN funds)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: US federal agencies

questions.question: What is the most likely suffix of the email address of someone who is Dutch?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Symbol and Chemical Symbol
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, hotel-owner, chemical. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for Lanthanum?
What is the chemical symbol for Uranium?
What is the chemical symbol for Ytterbium?
This is the length of the longest fingernails.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 24.60 feet (7.5 m)

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol of Einsteinium, a rare earth metal named after Albert Einstein.
The oldest male stripper was that old when the record was documented.
What is the chemical symbol for Iron?
This is the length of the worlds longest documented hair.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 18.37 feet  (5.6 m)

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for Vanadium?
In 1993 the Scottish hotel-owner Campbell Aird received a bionic organ, which was the first of its kind. This is the organ.
What is the chemical symbol for Thorium?
What is the symbol for Americium?
The greatest age to which any man has ever lived is this.
What is the chemical symbol for Boron?
The lightest baby weighed this much.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9.87 ounce (280 g)

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Dinosaurs and Period
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, velociraptors, appearance. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: It is interesting to note that contrary to popular belief, by scientific definiton, there were no dinosaurs of this type.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: neither flying nor marine dinosaurs

questions.question: Popularized by the Jurassic Park movie, velociraptors were relatively small carnivorous dinosaurs, which had evolved to be the perfect killers. What feature of their body in particular, helped them become such effective hunters?

options.text: An extra claw on their hind limbs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An extra claw on their hind limbs

questions.question: Despite the fierce image movies have attributed to dinosaurs, approximately this percent of dinosaurs fed on plants and were quite peaceful.
What was the most impressive feature of the Stegosaurus appearance, which makes it the most easily identifiable dinosaur even for the non-expert observer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kite-shaped plates

questions.question: This is the most rare disease.
Animal foods generally contain more saturated fats that plant foods.

Dinosaurs appeared about 230 million years ago during the Triassic period and became extinct about 160 million years later, during the Cretaceous period. What is the period which marked the peak of dinosaurs reign on land referred to?
What is the name for all the chemical reactions that take place in the body?
Roy C Sullivan survived this number of lighting strikes.
The longest coma lasted approximately this long.
You shouldnt wash berries before you store them.
Where does the majority of nutrient absorption take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: small intestine

questions.question: Which of the following is high in Vitamin E?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sunflower seeds

questions.question: This is the biggest number of transplanted organs in a person.
These are compounds that help protect cells from free radicals.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Rain and Star
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, drought, ph. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This chemical element is the final element produced by stellar nucleosynthesis and the heaviest element which does not require a supernova for its formation.
Consuming too much alcohol can raise fats in the blood.
Who was the first person to study the shape of a raindrop in 1898?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Philipp Lenard

questions.question: Too much rainfall can kill plants, just like a drought.
Can overnutrition cause malnutrition?
Not all rain reaches the Earths surface.
This astronomical term refers to the outermost layer of the sun, which is a low density cloud of plasma, with higher transparency than the inner layers.
This constellation in the Northern Hemisphere was named after a Greek mythological figure, whose name is translated as ruler over men.
This star, the second brightest star in the constellation Orion, is a red supergiant.
Rain below what pH is considered acid rain?
If you needed a good source of iron, this food would be the best.
This term refers to a celestial body that resembles a star but does not emit light, because it is too small to ignite internal nuclear fusion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brown Dwarf

questions.question: About how much of an adult humans body is water?
Convective rain occurs in regions with what daytime whether?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hot during the day

questions.question: There are 12 astronomical constellations.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Computer and Anthropology
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, boards, pithe. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Why is Blue Ray better than Red Ray/Laser?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It can read more memory.

questions.question: Who is considered to be the father of anthropology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franz Boas

questions.question: What does the prefix pithe refer to?
What does the Latin prefix homo refer to?
What are the little green boards in the computer called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: daughter cards

questions.question: How are hard drives and floppy disks read?
What is the long term memory of the computer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hard Drive

questions.question: What is the hottest part of the computer?
What does IC stand for in a computer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Integrated Circuit

questions.question: How are CDs and DVDs read?
Cultural anthropology was one of the two classical divisions of anthropology. What was the other one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Physical Anthropology

questions.question: What does the Greek prefix anthro refer to?
What does the ROM part of a CD-ROM stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Read Only Memory

questions.question: What is the big green board in the computer called?
What does RAM stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Random Access Memory
